text: Regulation of <extra_id_0> IL-17 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production in RA PBMC by inflammatory cytokines and chemokines

Because RA PBMC include several cell types in addition to T cells , some inflammatory cytokines released from macrophages and other lymphocytes might have affected the production of <extra_id_0> IL-17 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> from T cells .

To evaluate the effects of inflammatory cytokines released by activated PBMC , we tested the effects of several cytokines and chemokines on <extra_id_0> IL-17 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production .

We detected an increase in <extra_id_0> IL-17 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> level after stimulation with <extra_id_0> IL-15 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 10 ng / ml ) , whereas with <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 10 ng / ml ) , <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 10 ng / ml ) , <extra_id_0> IL-18 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 10 ng / ml ) or <extra_id_0> TGF-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 10 ng / ml ) the levels in <extra_id_0> IL-17 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were unchanged ( Fig . 2a ) .

When treated with <extra_id_0> MCP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 10 ng / ml ) or <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 10 ng / ml ) , significant upregulations of <extra_id_0> IL-17 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins were observed ( 62 +/- 42 and 50 +/- 10 versus 31 +/- 11 pg / ml , respectively ; P < 0.05 ) , whereas none was observed with <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 10 ng / ml ) , <extra_id_0> MIP-1alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 10 ng / ml ) or <extra_id_0> MIP-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 10 ng / ml ) ( Fig . 2b ) .
